title: (x) "Motocicli Zaccardo" Art Deco sans in Nike advertising - (similar to) FF Typeface Six {Yves}
content:
[http://www.ibelieveinadv.com/commons/nike\_italy\_zaccardo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.ibelieveinadv.com/commons/nike_italy_zaccardo.jpg "http://www.ibelieveinadv.com/commons/nike\_italy\_zaccardo.jpg")

Anyone familiar with this sans - Motocicli Zaccardo
author: garden

comments.content: Adapted from or at least inspired by [Neville Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Neville%20Brody)'s [FF Typeface Six](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.1061.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=MOTOCICLI+ZACCARDO&sampleSize=24).

Yves thanks again.

Anything similar also?

Btw, what art style infulences these posters?

-  
golden ratio of passion. sansogno.coastaldisturbance.com

It reminds me the posters of A. M. Cassandre

Dino

Italian Art Deco style, from ending 20's and 30's.  
Some examples I've quickly googled :  
- [http://www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl07311](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl07311 "http://www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl07311")  
- [http://www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl01334](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl01334 "http://www.internationalposter.com/wdetail.cfm?ImageName=itl01334")  
- [http://www.internationalposter.com/pimages/ITL01317s.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.internationalposter.com/pimages/ITL01317s.jpg "http://www.internationalposter.com/pimages/ITL01317s.jpg")

Remind me a the spirit of geometry of the monumental "Mostra" font.  
And behind of all, the "futurism" italian movement, focused on modernity, machines and speed.

Art Deco posters : [http://www.enjoyart.com/art\_deco4.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.enjoyart.com/art_deco4.htm "http://www.enjoyart.com/art\_deco4.htm")

By the way, this poster amazed me :  
 [http://www.enjoyart.com/single\_posters/art\_deco/martini\_row.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.enjoyart.com/single_posters/art_deco/martini_row.htm "http://www.enjoyart.com/single\_posters/art\_deco/martini\_row.htm")

Inspired by this art period is Mark Simonson's [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107232254/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=15&displayfontid=MSF.118749.0.0&fontRendererText=MOTOCICLI).
